solution: Factoring a $2$ out of the second term gives $2(x+3)(x-3)=2(x^2-3^2)=\boxed{2x^2-18}$.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Apply the distributive property
$(x+3)(2x-6) = x(2x-6) + 3(2x-6)$
## Step 2: Expand the expressions
$x(2x-6) + 3(2x-6) = 2x^2 - 6x + 6x - 18$
## Step 3: Simplify the expression
$2x^2 - 6x + 6x - 18 = 2x^2 - 18$
## Step 4: Final Answer
$2x^2 - 18$
steps:
## Step 1: Apply the distributive property
$(x+3)(2x-6) = x(2x-6) + 3(2x-6)$
full_steps:
## Step 1: Apply the distributive property
$(x+3)(2x-6) = x(2x-6) + 3(2x-6)$
